fileFormat.codeMetaInfo:
Parent Type
schema:CreativeWork
Description
Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry
Type
Text or URL
This codeMeta Field
Array || String
fileFormat.expanded:
Expanded JSON-LD
?
fileFormat.compacted:
Compacted JSON-LD
?
fileFormat.info:
Please provide your application file(s) format.

More details: IANA site

Several entries can be written in a comma-seperated list.

codeMetaJSonLD.JSonLDInfo:
Vocabulary 2.0
https://tinyurl.com/9scdncdj
jsonLD Example
https://tinyurl.com/3xzs6jwf

swRadio.published: Yes: if this SW has been published in association with a scholarly publication.
swRadio.repository: Yes: if this repository holds additional data associated with its development progress.
swRadio.bundle: Yes: if this SW is additionally available as an installable/buildable software.
swRadio.fileSystem: Yes: if this SW holds additional data associated to its installation on disks.
swRadio.code: Yes: if this SW holds additional data associated to its coding functionality.
swRadio.performance: Yes: if this SW holds additional data associated to its performance requirements.
